column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.There have been two more Covid-19-related deaths recorded in Northern Ireland in the past 24 hours
column2: with the total number of deaths now 2
column3: 135.Another 99 people have tested positive for coronavirus.There are 70 people in hospitals with Covid-19 - eight of them are in intensive care. Five are being ventilated.The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Northern Ireland stands at 118
column5: 826 people in Northern Ireland have received one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine
column7: 917 have received two doses.The total number of vaccines administered in Northern Ireland is now 1
column9: 743.Last updated 17 April at 14:30 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe Republic of Ireland has recorded four more Covid-19-related deaths
column10: with the total number of deaths now standing at 4
column11: 835.All four of the deaths occurred in April. Another 420 people have tested positive with coronavirus.The total number of confirmed Covid-19 cases in the Republic of Ireland now stands at 243
column12: 238.There are 183 people with Covid-19 in hospitals - 50 are currently in intensive care.Last updated 17 April at 17:15 local time.As of 15 April
column14: 470 people have received one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine
column16: 129 people have received two doses.The total number of vaccines administered in the Republic of Ireland is 1
column18: 599.Last updated 17 April at 17:15 local time.Source: Department of Health Ireland
